titles.title: Expressing support for designation of October as "National Farm to School Month".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Ms. Hirono moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1655.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Healthy Families and Communities.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and Labor

bill.summary: 11/16/2010--Passed House amended. Supports designation of National Farm to School Month. Encourages: (1) schools and local education agencies to use local produce in meals; and (2) schools, farmers and farm groups, local businesses, nonprofit institutions, churches, cities, state governments, and other local groups to raise awareness of Farm to School efforts in their communities.
